page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: The majority of buildings in this area are new - they were built in the last 30 years when Hythe began to develop. Many of these are built of red brick and have slanted roofs made of slate. In the 50's and 60's the houses were box shaped and uninteresting but now efforts have been made to make them look more attractive - for example double glazing has been installed in some houses. This makes the houses soundproof and warmer. Some people live in houses, some in bungalows. Some are detached, some semi-detached and some terraced. There are some flats in the area. Most houses have 2-4 bedrooms, a kitchen, a bathroom and a lounge. Some people think their houses are too small so they have extensions built. Most houses also have gardens.
